sub_topic: Identifying the clique number of a graph.
message_1:
Find the clique number of the following graph:

```
    A----B
   / \   |
  /   \  |
 C-----D-E
```

Assume that the vertices A, B, C, D, and E represent people and the edges connecting them represent friendships. The clique number of a graph is the size of the largest complete subgraph, where all vertices are directly connected to each other.
message_2:
In this graph, we can see the following cliques (complete subgraphs):

1. A-B (2 vertices)
2. A-C (2 vertices)
3. A-D (2 vertices)
4. B-E (2 vertices)
5. C-D (2 vertices)
6. A-C-D (3 vertices)

The largest clique in this graph is A-C-D, which has 3 vertices. Therefore, the clique number of the graph is 3.
